description: You need to get permission for any filming that may disrupt traffice on TfL's road network

texts: London's roads provide many popular locations for filming and photography.
We are the Highway Authority for London's red routes . You need to get permission from us before you start to film or photograph on our network.
This is true for everyone, no matter what subject is being filmed, the equipment being used, or size of crew.
Use the map below to find out if we are the authority for the road you want to film or photograph on.
All red routes are marked on the map. All other roads are managed by the local borough - you need to contact them directly for the permission you need.

{"template":"table","titles":["Name","Shoot details","Fees"],"rows":[[],["Small","Cast and crew of up to 5 people\u003cbr /\u003e","£75\u003cbr /\u003e"],["Medium","Cast and crew of 6-25 people\u003cbr /\u003e","£225\u003cbr /\u003e"],["Large\u003cbr /\u003e","Cast and crew of 26+\u003cbr /\u003e","£450\u003cbr /\u003e"],["Multi-location\u003cbr /\u003e","3+ locations\u003cbr /\u003e","£1350\u003cbr /\u003e(+£450 for every additional location)\u003cbr /\u003e"],["Additional changes\u003cbr /\u003e","Any changes to applications will incur a supplementary fee, for example for dates, equipment, location changes\u003cbr /\u003e","£150"],["Meeting(s)\u003cbr /\u003e","With TfL representatives\u003cbr /\u003e","£150 per meeting\u003cbr /\u003e"]]}
TfL's terms and conditions and associated licence fees are detailed in the application form below.
